availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Hale Ives Goddard (Providence, Rhode Island, soldier. Staff of Ambrose E. Burnside.)

body.p: Providence, Rhode Island, soldier. Rhode Island native. Son of William Giles Goddard and Charlotte Rhoda Ives Goddard. Student in Providence, Rhode Island, in 1850. Graduated from Brown University in Providence in 1858. Resident of Providence in 1860. Served in the 1st Rhode Island Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from May 2, 1861, to August 2, 1861. Served on the staff of Major-General Ambrose E. Burnside from September 11, 1862, to May 25, 1869.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Rhode Island, Providence County, Providence Ward 2, p. 113B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Rhode Island, Providence County, Providence Ward 2, p. 40.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Rhode Island, Providence County, Providence Ward 2, p. 266A.
"Colonel R. H. I. Goddard Found Dead in Bed," The New York Times (New York, New York), April 24, 1916, p. 13.
William Richard Cutter, ed., New England Families, Genealogical and Memorial: A Record of the Achievements of Her People in the Making of Commonwealths and the Founding of a Nation, vol. IV (New York: Lewis Historical Publishing Company, 1914), 1835-7.
